alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 4:00PM EDT until April 07 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gaylord MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. .Runoff from recent heavy rain will result in the Rifle River to exceed flood stage. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, High water begins to impact campground at White`s Canoe Livery at Melita Road bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 7.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 04/27/1937. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM EDT.
